verses.kjv: Then said Solomon, The LORD hath said that he would dwell in the thick darkness.
verses.web: Then Solomon said, “LORD has said that he would dwell in the thick darkness.
verses.ct: Then Solomon declared, "The LORD has said that he would dwell in thick darkness."

verses.kjv: But I have built an house of habitation for thee, and a place for thy dwelling for ever.
verses.web: But I have built you a house and home, a place for you to dwell in forever.”
verses.ct: "But I have built a house for you — a place for you to live forever."

verses.kjv: And the king turned his face, and blessed the whole congregation of Israel: and all the congregation of Israel stood.
verses.web: The king turned his face, and blessed all the assembly of Israel: and all the assembly of Israel stood.
verses.ct: Then the king turned to face the entire assembly of Israel and blessed them while they all stood.

verses.kjv: And he said, Blessed be the LORD God of Israel, who hath with his hands fulfilled that which he spake with his mouth to my father David, saying,
verses.web: He said, “Blessed be LORD, the God of Israel, who spoke with his mouth to David my father, and has with his hands fulfilled it, saying,
verses.ct: He said, "Praise the LORD, the God of Israel! He made a promise to my father David with his own mouth, and now he has fulfilled it with his own hands. He said,

verses.kjv: Since the day that I brought forth my people out of the land of Egypt I chose no city among all the tribes of Israel to build an house in, that my name might be there; neither chose I any man to be a ruler over my people Israel:
verses.web: ‘Since the day that I brought my people out of the land of Egypt, I chose no city out of all the tribes of Israel to build a house in, that my name might be there and I chose no man to be prince over my people Israel;
verses.ct: 'From the day I brought my people out of Egypt, I never chose a city from any tribe of Israel as the place to build a house where my name would dwell. And I never chose anyone to be ruler over my people Israel.

verses.kjv: But I have chosen Jerusalem, that my name might be there; and have chosen David to be over my people Israel.
verses.web: but now I have chosen Jerusalem, that my name might be there; and I have chosen David to be over my people Israel.’
verses.ct: But now I have chosen Jerusalem as the place for my name, and I have chosen David to lead my people Israel.'

verses.kjv: Now it was in the heart of David my father to build an house for the name of the LORD God of Israel.
verses.web: Now it was in the heart of David my father to build a house for the name of LORD, the God of Israel.
verses.ct: My father David had it in his heart to build a house for the name of the LORD, the God of Israel.

verses.kjv: But the LORD said to David my father, Forasmuch as it was in thine heart to build an house for my name, thou didst well in that it was in thine heart:
verses.web: But LORD said to David my father, ‘Whereas it was in your heart to build a house for my name, you did well that it was in your heart;
verses.ct: But the LORD told my father David, 'It was good that you wanted to build a house for my name. You did well to have that desire in your heart.

verses.kjv: Notwithstanding thou shalt not build the house; but thy son which shall come forth out of thy loins, he shall build the house for my name.
verses.web: nevertheless you shall not build the house; but your son who will come out of your body, he shall build the house for my name.’
verses.ct: However, you will not be the one to build it. Instead, your own son will build the house for my name.'

verses.kjv: The LORD therefore hath performed his word that he hath spoken: for I am risen up in the room of David my father, and am set on the throne of Israel, as the LORD promised, and have built the house for the name of the LORD God of Israel.
verses.web: “LORD has performed his word that he spoke; for I have risen up in the place of David my father, and sit on the throne of Israel, as LORD promised, and have built the house for the name of LORD, the God of Israel.
verses.ct: The LORD has kept the promise he made. I have taken my father David's place and now sit on the throne of Israel, just as the LORD promised. And I have built this house for the name of the LORD, the God of Israel.

verses.kjv: And in it have I put the ark, wherein is the covenant of the LORD, that he made with the children of Israel.
verses.web: There I have set the ark, in which is LORD’s covenant, which he made with the children of Israel.”
verses.ct: Inside it I have placed the ark, which holds the covenant the LORD made with the people of Israel."

verses.kjv: And he stood before the altar of the LORD in the presence of all the congregation of Israel, and spread forth his hands:
verses.web: He stood before LORD’s altar in the presence of all the assembly of Israel, and spread out his hands
verses.ct: Solomon stood before the LORD's altar in front of the entire assembly of Israel and stretched out his hands.

verses.kjv: For Solomon had made a brasen scaffold of five cubits long, and five cubits broad, and three cubits high, and had set it in the midst of the court: and upon it he stood, and kneeled down upon his knees before all the congregation of Israel, and spread forth his hands toward heaven,
verses.web: (for Solomon had made a bronze platform, five cubits long, and five cubits wide, and three cubits high, and had set it in the middle of the court; and he stood on it, and knelt down on his knees before all the assembly of Israel, and spread out his hands toward heaven)
verses.ct: He had built a bronze platform 5 cubits long, 5 cubits wide, and 3 cubits high, and placed it in the center of the courtyard. He stood on it, then knelt down on his knees before the whole assembly of Israel and raised his hands toward heaven.

verses.kjv: And said, O LORD God of Israel, there is no God like thee in the heaven, nor in the earth; which keepest covenant, and shewest mercy unto thy servants, that walk before thee with all their hearts:
verses.web: and he said, “LORD, the God of Israel, there is no God like you in heaven or on earth; you who keep covenant and loving kindness with your servants who walk before you with all their heart;
verses.ct: He prayed, "LORD, God of Israel, there is no God like you in heaven or on earth. You keep your covenant and show mercy to your servants who follow you wholeheartedly.

verses.kjv: Thou which hast kept with thy servant David my father that which thou hast promised him; and spakest with thy mouth, and hast fulfilled it with thine hand, as it is this day.
verses.web: who have kept with your servant David my father that which you promised him. Yes, you spoke with your mouth, and have fulfilled it with your hand, as it is today.
verses.ct: You kept the promise you made to your servant David, my father. What you spoke with your mouth, you have fulfilled with your hand — and we can see it today.

verses.kjv: Now therefore, O LORD God of Israel, keep with thy servant David my father that which thou hast promised him, saying, There shall not fail thee a man in my sight to sit upon the throne of Israel; yet so that thy children take heed to their way to walk in my law, as thou hast walked before me.
verses.web: “Now therefore, LORD, the God of Israel, keep with your servant David my father that which you have promised him, saying, ‘There shall not fail you a man in my sight to sit on the throne of Israel, if only your children take heed to their way, to walk in my law as you have walked before me.’
verses.ct: Now, LORD, God of Israel, keep the other promise you made to my father David when you said, 'You will always have a descendant sitting on the throne of Israel in my sight — as long as your children are careful to follow my law, just as you have walked before me.'

verses.kjv: Now then, O LORD God of Israel, let thy word be verified, which thou hast spoken unto thy servant David.
verses.web: Now therefore, LORD, the God of Israel, let your word be verified, which you spoke to your servant David.
verses.ct: So now, LORD, God of Israel, let the word you spoke to your servant David come true.

verses.kjv: But will God in very deed dwell with men on the earth? behold, heaven and the heaven of heavens cannot contain thee; how much less this house which I have built!
verses.web: “But will God indeed dwell with men on the earth? Behold, heaven and the heaven of heavens can’t contain you; how much less this house which I have built!
verses.ct: "But will God really live with people on earth? Even heaven — the highest heavens — cannot contain you. How much less this house I have built!

verses.kjv: Have respect therefore to the prayer of thy servant, and to his supplication, O LORD my God, to hearken unto the cry and the prayer which thy servant prayeth before thee:
verses.web: Yet have respect for the prayer of your servant, and to his supplication, LORD my God, to listen to the cry and to the prayer which your servant prays before you;
verses.ct: Yet please pay attention to your servant's prayer and plea, LORD my God. Hear the cry and the prayer your servant is praying before you.

verses.kjv: That thine eyes may be open upon this house day and night, upon the place whereof thou hast said that thou wouldest put thy name there; to hearken unto the prayer which thy servant prayeth toward this place.
verses.web: that your eyes may be open toward this house day and night, even toward the place where you have said that you would put your name; to listen to the prayer which your servant will pray toward this place.
verses.ct: Let your eyes be open toward this house day and night — this place where you said you would put your name — and listen to the prayer your servant offers toward this place.

verses.kjv: Hearken therefore unto the supplications of thy servant, and of thy people Israel, which they shall make toward this place: hear thou from thy dwelling place, even from heaven; and when thou hearest, forgive.
verses.web: Listen to the petitions of your servant, and of your people Israel, when they pray toward this place. Yes, hear from your dwelling place, even from heaven; and when you hear, forgive.
verses.ct: Hear the prayers of your servant and your people Israel when they pray toward this place. Hear from heaven, your dwelling place, and when you hear, forgive.

verses.kjv: If a man sin against his neighbour, and an oath be laid upon him to make him swear, and the oath come before thine altar in this house;
verses.web: “If a man sins against his neighbor, and an oath is laid on him to cause him to swear, and he comes and swears before your altar in this house;
verses.ct: "When someone sins against another person and is required to take an oath, and that person comes and swears before your altar in this house —

verses.kjv: Then hear thou from heaven, and do, and judge thy servants, by requiting the wicked, by recompensing his way upon his own head; and by justifying the righteous, by giving him according to his righteousness.
verses.web: then hear from heaven, act, and judge your servants, bringing retribution to the wicked, to bring his way on his own head; and justifying the righteous, to give him according to his righteousness.
verses.ct: then hear from heaven and act. Judge between your servants: punish the guilty by bringing the consequences of their actions down on their own heads, and vindicate the innocent by rewarding them for their righteousness.

verses.kjv: And if thy people Israel be put to the worse before the enemy, because they have sinned against thee; and shall return and confess thy name, and pray and make supplication before thee in this house;
verses.web: “If your people Israel are struck down before the enemy because they have sinned against you, and they turn again and confess your name, and pray and make supplication before you in this house;
verses.ct: "When your people Israel are defeated by an enemy because they have sinned against you, and then they turn back, confess your name, and pray and plead before you in this house —

verses.kjv: Then hear thou from the heavens, and forgive the sin of thy people Israel, and bring them again unto the land which thou gavest to them and to their fathers.
verses.web: then hear from heaven, and forgive the sin of your people Israel, and bring them again to the land which you gave to them and to their fathers.
verses.ct: then hear from heaven, forgive the sin of your people Israel, and bring them back to the land you gave to them and their ancestors.

verses.kjv: When the heaven is shut up, and there is no rain, because they have sinned against thee; yet if they pray toward this place, and confess thy name, and turn from their sin, when thou dost afflict them;
verses.web: “When the sky is shut up, and there is no rain, because they have sinned against you; if they pray toward this place, and confess your name, and turn from their sin, when you afflict them;
verses.ct: "When the sky is shut and there is no rain because they have sinned against you, and then they pray toward this place, confess your name, and turn from their sin because you have humbled them —

verses.kjv: Then hear thou from heaven, and forgive the sin of thy servants, and of thy people Israel, when thou hast taught them the good way, wherein they should walk; and send rain upon thy land, which thou hast given unto thy people for an inheritance.
verses.web: then hear in heaven, and forgive the sin of your servants of your people Israel, when you teach them the good way in which they should walk; and send rain on your land, which you have given to your people for an inheritance.
verses.ct: then hear from heaven and forgive the sin of your servants, your people Israel. Teach them the right way to live, and send rain on the land you gave your people as their inheritance.

verses.kjv: If there be dearth in the land, if there be pestilence, if there be blasting, or mildew, locusts, or caterpillers; if their enemies besiege them in the cities of their land; whatsoever sore or whatsoever sickness there be:
verses.web: “If there is famine in the land, if there is pestilence, if there is blight or mildew, locust or caterpillar; if their enemies besiege them in the land of their cities; whatever plague or whatever sickness there is;
verses.ct: "When there is famine in the land, or plague, or crop disease, or mildew, or swarms of locusts or caterpillars — or when enemies lay siege to any of their cities — whatever disaster or sickness strikes —

verses.kjv: Then what prayer or what supplication soever shall be made of any man, or of all thy people Israel, when every one shall know his own sore and his own grief, and shall spread forth his hands in this house:
verses.web: whatever prayer and supplication is made by any man, or by all your people Israel, who will each know his own plague and his own sorrow, and shall spread out his hands toward this house;
verses.ct: then whatever prayer or plea is made by any person or by all your people Israel — each one aware of their own suffering and grief — when they stretch out their hands toward this house,

verses.kjv: Then hear thou from heaven thy dwelling place, and forgive, and render unto every man according unto all his ways, whose heart thou knowest; (for thou only knowest the hearts of the children of men:)
verses.web: then hear from heaven your dwelling place and forgive, and render to every man according to all his ways, whose heart you know (for you, even you only, know the hearts of the children of men)
verses.ct: hear from heaven, your dwelling place. Forgive, and deal with each person according to how they live, since you know their heart. You alone know the hearts of all people.

verses.kjv: That they may fear thee, to walk in thy ways, so long as they live in the land which thou gavest unto our fathers.
verses.web: that they may fear you, to walk in your ways, so long as they live in the land which you gave to our fathers.
verses.ct: Do this so they will fear you and walk in your ways for as long as they live in the land you gave our ancestors.

verses.kjv: Moreover concerning the stranger, which is not of thy people Israel, but is come from a far country for thy great name’s sake, and thy mighty hand, and thy stretched out arm; if they come and pray in this house;
verses.web: “Moreover concerning the foreigner, who is not of your people Israel, when he comes from a far country for your great name’s sake, and your mighty hand, and your outstretched arm; when they come and pray toward this house;
verses.ct: "As for the foreigner who doesn't belong to your people Israel but has come from a distant land because of your great name, your mighty hand, and your outstretched arm — when they come and pray toward this house,

verses.kjv: Then hear thou from the heavens, even from thy dwelling place, and do according to all that the stranger calleth to thee for; that all people of the earth may know thy name, and fear thee, as doth thy people Israel, and may know that this house which I have built is called by thy name.
verses.web: then hear from heaven, even from your dwelling place, and do according to all that the foreigner calls to you for; that all the peoples of the earth may know your name and fear you, as do your people Israel, and that they may know that this house which I have built is called by your name.
verses.ct: hear from heaven, your dwelling place, and do whatever the foreigner asks of you. Do this so that all the peoples of the earth may know your name and fear you, just as your people Israel do, and so they may know that this house I have built bears your name.

verses.kjv: If thy people go out to war against their enemies by the way that thou shalt send them, and they pray unto thee toward this city which thou hast chosen, and the house which I have built for thy name;
verses.web: “If your people go out to battle against their enemies, by whatever way you send them, and they pray to you toward this city which you have chosen, and the house which I have built for your name;
verses.ct: "When your people go out to war against their enemies, wherever you send them, and they pray to you facing this city you have chosen and the house I have built for your name —

verses.kjv: Then hear thou from the heavens their prayer and their supplication, and maintain their cause.
verses.web: then hear from heaven their prayer and their supplication, and maintain their cause.
verses.ct: then hear their prayer and their plea from heaven, and uphold their cause.

verses.kjv: If they sin against thee, (for there is no man which sinneth not,) and thou be angry with them, and deliver them over before their enemies, and they carry them away captives unto a land far off or near;
verses.web: “If they sin against you (for there is no man who doesn’t sin), and you are angry with them, and deliver them to the enemy, so that they carry them away captive to a land far off or near;
verses.ct: "When they sin against you — and there is no one who doesn't sin — and you become angry with them and hand them over to their enemies, who carry them away as captives to a land far or near,

verses.kjv: Yet if they bethink themselves in the land whither they are carried captive, and turn and pray unto thee in the land of their captivity, saying, We have sinned, we have done amiss, and have dealt wickedly;
verses.web: yet if they come to their senses in the land where they are carried captive, and turn again, and make supplication to you in the land of their captivity, saying, ‘We have sinned, we have done perversely, and have dealt wickedly;’
verses.ct: and if they come to their senses in the land where they are held captive, and they repent and cry out to you saying, 'We have sinned, we have done wrong, we have been wicked' —

verses.kjv: If they return to thee with all their heart and with all their soul in the land of their captivity, whither they have carried them captives, and pray toward their land, which thou gavest unto their fathers, and toward the city which thou hast chosen, and toward the house which I have built for thy name:
verses.web: if they return to you with all their heart and with all their soul in the land of their captivity, where they have carried them captive, and pray toward their land, which you gave to their fathers, and the city which you have chosen, and toward the house which I have built for your name;
verses.ct: if they return to you with all their heart and soul in the land of their captivity, and pray facing the land you gave their ancestors, facing the city you have chosen, and facing the house I have built for your name —

verses.kjv: Then hear thou from the heavens, even from thy dwelling place, their prayer and their supplications, and maintain their cause, and forgive thy people which have sinned against thee.
verses.web: then hear from heaven, even from your dwelling place, their prayer and their petitions, and maintain their cause, and forgive your people who have sinned against you.
verses.ct: then hear from heaven, your dwelling place, hear their prayer and their pleas, uphold their cause, and forgive your people who have sinned against you.

verses.kjv: Now, my God, let, I beseech thee, thine eyes be open, and let thine ears be attent unto the prayer that is made in this place.
verses.web: “Now, my God, let, I beg you, your eyes be open, and let your ears be attentive, to the prayer that is made in this place.
verses.ct: "Now, my God, I beg you — let your eyes be open and your ears attentive to every prayer made in this place.

verses.kjv: Now therefore arise, O LORD God, into thy resting place, thou, and the ark of thy strength: let thy priests, O LORD God, be clothed with salvation, and let thy saints rejoice in goodness.
verses.web: “Now therefore arise, LORD God, into your resting place, you, and the ark of your strength. Let your priests, LORD God, be clothed with salvation, and let your saints rejoice in goodness.
verses.ct: Rise up now, LORD God, and come to your resting place — you and the ark of your strength. Let your priests, LORD God, be clothed with salvation, and let your faithful people rejoice in your goodness.

verses.kjv: O LORD God, turn not away the face of thine anointed: remember the mercies of David thy servant.
verses.web: “LORD God, don’t turn away the face of your anointed. Remember your loving kindnesses to David your servant.”
verses.ct: LORD God, do not turn away from your anointed one. Remember the mercy you promised to your servant David."
